title: What is the significance of sacrifice in ancient traditions and how does it relate to creation?
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens of this text, the idea of sacrifice and its efficacy in creating or renewing a god is discussed. The concept of sacrifice is rooted in various traditions and cultures, including the sacrificial actions of builders in ancient times to create an entity tied to a house, temple, or city. The author also highlights the connection between sacrifice and the progression of an experience where the sacrifice and victory can create or renew a god. The text emphasizes the idea that sacrifices can reproduce those that originally constituted the substance and how the action of sacrifice can wound or hurt a god.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the heroic experience can be viewed as a sacrificial action that gives birth to a god, just as the periodic sacrifices and bloody games in Rome aimed to evoke magical entities. The progressions and rhythms of the heroic experience can be recognized as the phases of a sacrificial action, where sacrifice and victory coincide in one being, and victory itself can create or renew a god.
